item.name: Elemental Ink
entries: Simile all'inchiostro bestiale, l'inchiostro elementale è un simbolo o una rappresentazione dei quattro elementi di base che garantisce benefici diversi a seconda della loro posizione sul corpo del personaggio. I personaggi possono possedere più tatuaggi di inchiostro elementale purché occupino slot diversi, ma non possono avere tatuaggi di elementi opposti (fuoco e freddo, terra e aria, ecc.). Armatura o corpo: Il personaggio è immune ai danni di quell'elemento, come per l'incantesimo protezione dall'energia. Il tatuaggio può assorbire 120 punti di quel tipo di energia al giorno. Testa: il personaggio può parlare la lingua elementale appropriata, come previsto dall'incantesimo comprendere lingue (senza limiti di durata). Collo: Il personaggio ottiene un'arma a soffio di quel tipo elementale, utilizzabile una volta al giorno, che infligge 1d4 punti di danno per livello del personaggio. Chi si trova nell'area del soffio può effettuare un tiro salvezza sui riflessi per dimezzare i danni. La DC di questo tiro salvezza è pari a 10 + 1/2 del proprio livello di personaggio + il proprio modificatore di Carisma. La forma e il tipo di arma a soffio dipendono dal tipo elementale scelto: Aria = linea di elettricità di 60 piedi; Terra = linea di acido di 60 piedi; Fuoco = cono di fuoco di 30 piedi; Acqua = cono di freddo di 30 piedi. Petto: Il personaggio ottiene una resistenza all'energia 10 contro quel tipo di elemento, come previsto dall'incantesimo resistere all'energia. Mani: Il personaggio infligge 1d4 danni elementali aggiuntivi ad ogni attacco in mischia riuscito, sia armato che disarmato.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), Alchemist Supplies;

item.name: Elf Friend
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i This tattoo is usually done in gold and black ink and seems to have highlights mirroring the leaves of the forests. It is a geometric pattern, thin and light, tracing from the outside of one eye down the cheek bone, and it signals to all who recognize it that the tattoo bearer is a friend of the elven race.}

Although there are non-magical versions of this tattoo that grant a +1 bonus to Persuasion rolls with elves and help ensure safe passage through Elven lands, elves also know such things can be faked. The magic of this tattoo, however, is very hard to falsify. The elf friend tattoo grants advantage on Charisma checks and Charisma-based skill checks with elves, and when dealing with good-aligned fey creatures. However, it also imposes disadvantage on similar checks when dealing with any evil sylvan races and interactions with orcs. The bearer of the tattoo can also understand, speak, and read Elven. If the bearer does not already have darkvision (60ft), they gain it and advantage against saves for magical sleep. The elf friend tattoo is only granted to the most trusted of non-elf allies and friends, and anyone with an elf friend tattoo who attacks an elf, spies on elves, or in any other way betrays that trust will be hunted down by agents of those who granted the bearer the tattoo in the first place.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell tongues}, creator must be an elf held in regard to the elven community;

item.name: Eye of Steropes
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i The character's forehead is tattooed with a single large eye, like that of a cyclops.}

The character gains the ability to use the ability, {@b flash of insight}, which allows them to select the exact result of one die roll before the roll is made. This effect can Eye of Steropes alter an action taken by the character only, and cannot be applied to the rolls of others. The character can use the ability once per day.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell alter self} {@spell guidance} {@spell Augury};

item.name: Glamorous Mascara
entries: The character selects a basic scheme of makeup–rouge, eye shadow, lip tint, etc–which is then tattooed permanently onto their flesh. The tattoo is colorless until activated, at which point it infuses fully with the chosen colors for up to 8 hours per day. The 8 hours do not have to consecutive, and the glamorous mascara can be activated and deactivated numerous times during the day. It is a standard action to activate the tattoo.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell disguise self};

item.name: Gouzong's Exigent
entries: Una singola freccia è tatuata lungo il lato interno del braccio non dominante del personaggio. La punta della freccia si trova al polso o sul palmo della mano e quando il personaggio tira la corda dell'arco, il tatuaggio crea magicamente una freccia pronta a scoccare. Ogni giorno il personaggio ha a disposizione 1 freccia per ogni due livelli di personaggio (minimo 1). Le frecce create dal tatuaggio sono di qualità magistrale. Le frecce possono essere rese infuocate, gelate o scioccanti aggiungendo 2.000 gp al prezzo del tatuaggio. Alle frecce di Gouzong possono essere aggiunte solo una qualità extra. L'aggiunta di fiammeggiante, gelido o scioccante deve essere fatta al momento della creazione del tatuaggio; non può essere aggiunta al tatuaggio in un secondo momento. Se il personaggio ha già una freccia fisica in mano quando tira l'arco, il tatuaggio non creerà una freccia aggiuntiva.

items: {@i Creation Level Requirements}: 1st (8th for frost or shocking, 10th for flaming);
{@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell magic missile} (plus any spells needed for flaming, frost or shocking);

item.name: Great Hunter
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i The great hunter tattoo is usually illustrated as the object of a successful hunt–a ten-point stag, a fat boar, a healthy aurochs–though some hunters prefer the image of a pulled bow, arrow knocked and ready to fly.}

The tattoo's bearer receives proficiency on Survival checks when hunting, or expertise if they already have experience in Survival checks. The bonus from a great hunter tattoo only applies when hunting, not when using the Survival skill for picking a campsite, predicting the weather, etc.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell enhanced ability};

item.name: Hawk's Talons
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i The character has the talons of predatory birds tattooed on his hands.}

When activated, he grows large, curved talons designed for combat, and gains 2 claw attacks per round as a natural attack at his highest BAB, with each claw doing 1d4 points of damage (1d3 for Small-sized creatures, 1d6 for Large). In addition, the character receives advantage on their grapple attempts.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell alter self};

item.name: Hayabusa's Horrific Hag
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i The character's chest is adorned with the frightening image of a hag making a threatening gesture.}

When presented, the tattoo creates a potent fear effect, equal to the spell. The Wisdom Save DC for those affected is 12 + the tattooed character's Charisma modifier. The effect can be used once per day, and can only be used if the tattoo is visible (it has no effects when covered by clothing or armor). Anyone with the Sexy Ink feat cannot get this wondrous tattoo, and anyone with the Hayabusa's horrific hag wondrous tattoo cannot later gain the Sexy Ink feat.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell fear};

item.name: Heron Tattoo
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i This tattoo can be a simple glyph representing a heron, but is usually quite detailed and almost lifelike.}

Herons are traditionally considered symbols of grace, and in art are associated with the ruling caste of some cultures. The heron tattoo continually grants the wearer proficiency with Persuasion (or expertise if they are already proficient). Heron tattoos have always been popular among the Ryueken Order, and also among nobles and merchants.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Blur};

item.name: Hospitalier's Verse
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i This inscription of verse is done on the chest right above the heart, reflecting its status as a sacred vow. The verse varies with the holy text of the recipient's faith, but always invokes the requirement that the wearer give aid to those who are ill and need assistance.}

The bearer of the hospitalier's verse is immune to disease, including supernatural diseases. If the bearer ever willingly refuses aid to those who are ill without very good cause they lose their disease immunity. Foregoing aid in the short term to provide long-term aid or help a larger group is valid–putting personal cause above others is not.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell lesser restoration};

item.name: Lucky Ink
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i Symbols of luck, such as a seven-pointed star, coin, horseshoe, four-leaf clover, or other symbols of good fortune, may be placed anywhere on the body.}

Once every session, the tattooed character may reroll any one die roll, and use the better result. A character may have only one lucky ink tattoo. Having more than one, even if it is a different symbol of luck and in a different tattoo slot, cancels both out and, in fact, results in bad luck. For as long as both tattoos are possessed, the GM can direct the character once per day to reroll any one die roll and use the worse result of the two.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell guidance};

item.name: Madre Ophen's Sense Evil/Good Tattoo
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i This tattoo is of a sentinel bearing the sign of a good deity (the symbol usually being chosen by the character receiving the tattoo).}

When activated by concentration, the tattoo detects evil in a 5-foot-radius per 2 character levels around the bearer of the tattoo. In the presence of evil the tattoo glows and the character experiences burning pain equal to the strength of the evil/good detected . The tattoo does not locate or identify the source of the evil nor the number of evil auras present, only the presence of evil.

entries.name: Multiple Lucky Tattoos
entries: Volete aggiungere un effetto particolare causato da più personaggi con inchiostro fortunato? Utilizzate questa regola opzionale! Se più personaggi nel raggio di 30 metri possiedono tatuaggi con inchiostro fortunato, i tatuaggi interferiscono con l'efficacia reciproca. Se il numero totale di personaggi con l'inchiostro fortunato è pari, ogni volta che si effettua un tiro di dado, solo i numeri pari contano nel tiro di dado - i numeri dispari sono nulli, non hanno effetto e il personaggio è costretto a ripetere il tiro originale. Allo stesso modo, se il numero totale di personaggi con inchiostro fortunato è un numero dispari, allora solo i numeri dispari contano nei ritiri. L'implementazione di questa regola è un buon modo per evitare che ogni PC del gruppo si faccia un tatuaggio con l'inchiostro fortunato!

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Detect Evil and Good};

item.name: Mark of Atonement (punitive)
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i Located on the forehead and symbolizing the person's misdeeds, the mark of atonement reveals the penitent to all, but also indicates a sincere effort at making amends.}

The mark generally functions as per the spell atonement, and has the same requirements (the penitent one must be truly repentant and desire to atone for their transgressions). The mark cannot be removed by any means until the bearer has successfully attained redemption, at which point the mark fades of its own accord. The mark will reappear through any disguise, alter self or similar spell or effect, or any other attempts at hiding or concealing one's appearance, and will actually glow softly in darkness. The advantage to receiving the mark of atonement rather than simply submitting to an atonement spell is that the penitent one does not need to spend thousands of gold he may not have on incense and herbs. The drawback is that unlike the spell, the mark of atonement is not instantaneous. Upon receiving the mark, the bearer is tasked with performing some deed of atonement–one who usually takes anywhere from several days to several years to accomplish. While the penitent one is not compelled to complete the task, as they would be by a geas/ quest spell, until that task is completed, the mark of atonement remains, and the penitent one is not truly forgiven of his sins. Once the task is completed, the mark fades instantly and the tattoo bearer is fully atoned for his misdeeds.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Atonement};

item.name: Mark of Recall
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i the image of the location; or a runic circle.}

Gregor Darkwanderer, a wizard and inkantationist of the northlands, didn't do as much wandering as his name might suggest. He did, however, need things, and from time to time and would hire adventurers to procure those things for him. In order to insure a sought after item's quick return, Gregor crafted a magic tattoo with a one-time use. This ink, once tattooed on a subject, acts as a teleport spell, recalling the subject and everything he carries/holds to the summoning room of Gregor's tower. To activate the teleportation the subject slaps the mark and shouts, "Return!" The magic of the tattoo affects only the tattoo bearer and her gear, familiar, and/or divine animal companion. It will not teleport more than one individual otherwise, and will not transport pets or animals not magically bound to the tattoo bearer. A side effect of the activation is that the ink burns away as the magic activates, doing 1d4 fire damage, and leaving a non-magical brand-like mark in the same shape as the original tattoo. The ingredients for the ink of this tattoo were shared with several others, and soon it spread across the world. Though carefully guarded, there are several inkantationists and wizards who know how to craft a mark of recall. The design of the tattoo is usually symbolic of the location to which the bearer is to return (the original mark of recall was an image of Gregor's tower) but when secrecy is a must, an abstract image can be used. The tattoo must be in a location where it is easily reachable, so except for the most flexible of characters, the back is not recommended.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Teleportation Circle};

item.name: Mother Tattoo
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i Typically, mother tattoos are a stylized heart with the word "mom" or "mother" inside, but sometimes is just the text alone.}

Mother tattoos are usually possessed by those who have strong attachments to loving, caring mothers. Once per day, the tattoo can be activated to provide a bless effect (as per the spell, lasting 1 minute) and a protection from evil effect (as per the spell, lasting 1 minute). The two effects must be activated separately, and each can be activated once per short rest. There are rumors that an alternate form of this tattoo is possessed by some who hated their mothers or who had domineering, abusive mothers. These tattoos are said to cause fear in others, or to cause others to shrink in size.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Bless}, {@spell Protection from Evil and Good};

item.name: Overlapping Rainbows
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i One rainbow tattoo placed atop another.}

This wondrous tattoo grants the bearer the ability to use a type of color spray effect three times per day. The primary difference from the color spray spell is that instead of stunned, blinded and unconscious, the effects of overlapping rainbows can leave targets dazzled, stunned or fascinated. The Wisdom Save DC to resist the effects is 14.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Color Spray};

item.name: Parent's Reminder
entries: Many adventurers journey far from home, leaving their children behind where they're safe. Some adventuring parents carry reminders on their skin in the form of children's initials, dates of birth, or favorite animals or toys. The tattoo can be activated once per day to locate the child the tattoo is tied to, with a range of 100 miles, or if further - know their general direction (the tattoo bearer and the child must be on the same plane of existence). The locate effect lasts for up to 1 hour once activated. In addition, once per day the tattoo allows the bearer to send a telepathic message to their child of up to 25 words. If the child is old enough to comprehend what is going on, the child can send a message of the same length back to the parent. One may have as many tattoos as they have children, each tied to a different child and in a different body slot. The tattoo is effective throughout the child's life.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12),  {@spell sending} {@spell Locate Creature};

item.name: Peacock Eyes
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A pair of peacock-like feather-encircled eyes tattooed on the character allows them to mesmerize a single target.}

The tattooed peacock eyes can be anywhere, but must be visible to others in order to be used. The tattooed character can choose to either fascinate (as the spell {@spell hypnotism}) or charm (as the spell {@spell charm monster}). Most who get this tattoo have it placed on their hands, around their own eyes or on their chest. The character can activate the tattoo once per short rest, using either effect desired (the same one twice, or each one once).

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Hypnotism}, {@spell Charm Monster};

item.name: Rat King
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i This tattoo is an image of a wheel made of filthy rats, their tails intertwined into a hub.}

The rat king tattoo grants the bearer power over rodents–when facing dire rats or rat swarms, the tattoo bearer effectively has the ability to charm them for up to 1 hour. Once per day the tattoo bearer can also summon a rat swarm, which will follow instructions for a number of rounds equal to the tattoo bearer's Charisma modifier before dispersing.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@sell charm monster}, {@sell Conjure Beast};

item.name: Rolling Bones
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A tattoo of a pair of 6-sided dice, usually placed in the palm or on the wrist.}

With a twitch of the wrist the bones appear in the hand ready for play. The rolling bones tattoo can be straight or (more commonly) cheater's dice. Many a dice player has lost his wrist and hand after being caught cheating, so those seeking this tattoo should beware. The dice can be used once per day for up to one hour. If used as cheater's dice, the tattoo bearer gains a proficiency with gaming (dice) or expertise if already proficient, and advantage to Deception checks while playing. If a Deception check fails by 5 or more, the bearer's gaming opponents have noticed the dice are loaded.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell creation}, {@spell guidance};

item.name: Rynzoe's Instant Lenses
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i the outside edge of each of the hands from the tip of the thumb to the tip of the forefinger with a single solid dark line}

Rynzoe Ziffergilz, gnomo inchiostratore e gioielliere, perdeva continuamente i suoi occhiali da vista. Dopo averli smarriti per l'ennesima volta, decise di creare un set di lenti che non avrebbe mai potuto perdere. Si tatuò il bordo esterno di ciascuna mano, dalla punta del pollice a quella dell'indice, con un'unica linea scura. Quando Rynzoe fece un cerchio con il pollice e l'indice, una lente magica brillò all'interno del foro creato. Con una mano (destra o sinistra) il cerchio diventava una lente d'ingrandimento. Con ogni mano che fa un cerchio e appoggia le unghie del pollice sul ponte del naso, crea occhiali da lettura per vedere da vicino o lenti correttive per vedere da lontano. Se allungava una mano davanti all'altra, pantomimando un telescopio, tra le mani appariva un tubo etereo che creava un telescopio magico. Quando metteva l'indice contro l'indice e il pollice contro il pollice, uno specchio brillava all'interno dello spazio. Rynzoe non perse mai più gli occhiali e il tatuaggio fu così apprezzato che lo ripeté per altri. Oggi il tatuaggio è piuttosto comune, richiesto dagli stessi inchiostratori, oltre che da gioiellieri, artigiani, furfanti e spie. Quando usa il tatuaggio come lente d'ingrandimento, il portatore del tatuaggio ottiene un bonus di competenza +5 alle prove di Percezione quando esamina le cose da vicino, compresa la ricerca di trappole, serrature o porte nascoste e un bonus di +5 alle prove di Artigianato. Quando viene usato come occhiale, il tatuaggio garantisce un bonus di +5 alle prove di Percezione per individuare persone e oggetti che non sono nascosti o che non cercano di nascondersi. Quando viene usato come telescopio, il portatore del tatuaggio può vedere due volte più lontano del normale (questo non influisce sulla scurovisione o sulla visione in condizioni di scarsa illuminazione). Quando viene usato come specchio, il tatuaggio agisce come uno specchio standard.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell true seeing};

item.name: Scarlet Bison
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i tattooed as a red bison, usually in a fighting position or preparing to charge}

Reputed to be a very invigorating tattoo, the scarlet bison (which is ) is often found on the young, affluent, and aggressive. It grants a permanent +2 bonus to initiative and Dexterity saves, but a -2 penalty to all Charisma-based skills. In addition, once per day, the player may make a Constitution save to resist fatigue with a DC of 12. If the save is failed, the character gains an additional level of exhaustion.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Enhance Ability};

item.name: Scarlet Letter (punitive)
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A large, red letter "A"–either a tattoo or a tinted brand–applied to the forehead or chest, the scarlet letter is used in conservative societies to mark both male and female adulterers.}

The bearer of the mark suffers disadvantage to all Charisma-based social checks when attempting to seduce anyone other than their spouse or significant other. Also, the bearer suffers disadvantage to all Charisma-based checks when dealing with anyone who considers adultery abhorrent. The scarlet letter can be removed in several ways. If the person you cheated on forgives you, the mark will fade away. The mark will also fade if a priest of your faith absolves you of your misdoings. Finally, if you undergo an atonement (as per the spell) or agree to a mark of atonement tattoo, you can absolve yourself of your sins, and the mark will disappear once you've completed your atonement.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell bestow curse};

item.name: Sea Legs
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A nautical themed tattoo, often taking the form of a ship, merfolk, anchor, dolphin, or the like, commonly worn by sailors.}

The tattoo grants the bearer powers while traveling through marine terrain. The character is immune to nausea caused by rough seas, advantage to Constitution saves against disease while at sea, and to Navigation (Nautical) skill checks. The character suffers no movement penalties while moving around a ship, including above deck, below deck, and in the rigging.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12),  {@spell guidance}, {@spell resistance};

item.name: Shoulla Mowan's Tattooed Rope
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i The character has a tattooed rope coiled around his arm which.}

When activated, produces a magical rope that the character can control as per animate rope. The rope is 50 feet + 5 feet per character level long. A grappling hook may be added to the tattoo, making it count for an additional slot (typically hand and wrist, or wrist and shoulder). The rope can be activated once per short rest.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Animate Objects} {@spell creation};

item.name: Sparkle and Flash
entries: Many of the exotic veiled dancers of the eastern lands are adorned in the spectacular sparkle and flash tattoos created by the inkantationist Balou Alvesair. The tattoos consist of faint lines on the flesh covering the bodies of the dancers, but in daylight or bright light they can hardly be noticed. However, in moonlight, torch-, fire-, or candlelight, they can be clearly seen. The tattoos are largely abstract images–curved lines, swirls, repeating patterns–with a few recognizable images such as flowers interspersed. When activated, the tattoos illuminate, sparkle and flash. As the dancer begins to twist and twirl the light show becomes effectively intoxicated and up to 2d3 viewers within 90 feet of the dancer must make a Wisdom Save (DC 11 + the dancer's Charisma modifier) or become fascinated (effectively {@condition incapacitated}). The fascinated condition lasts in the viewers for as long as the dancer continues to perform.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Charm Person};

item.name: Silvered Knuckles
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i Hands will appear silver.}

This tattoo is applied to the knuckles of both hands using a mixture of tattoo ink and molten alchemical silver. The bearer's fists then count as silver for purposes of vulernabilities. In addition to that ability, the tattoo bearer receives a +1 bonus to all unarmed attacks (or natural attacks with claws if polymorphed/wildshaped). The patterns of the tattoos commonly form runes against lycanthropy or are in praise of a deity who detests the curse of lycanthropy. The tattoo is common among rangers, druids, clerics, and paladins, but anyone can receive it.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell charm person};

item.name: Stormcall Tattoo
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A towering thundercloud with bolts of lightning}

This tattoo grants the bearer the passive power of reading the path of storms and guessing at their intensity. Also, once per week they can summon a thunderstorm, as long as they are under open sky. During the storm, the tattoo bearer can designate up to five different targets, all of whom will be struck by a lightning bolt once every 1d4 rounds (or until a maximum of 10 bolts have struck) for 3d6 damage each time (DC 15 Reflex save for half damage).

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell call lightning} & {@spell Druidcraft};

item.name: Summoning Ink, Lesser
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i This tattoo appears as a summoning circle with the outline of a monster in it.}

The tattoo functions as shadow conjuration, with the summoned monsters (drawn from the lists for summon monster III or lower) possessing 20% of their normal strength on disbelieving targets. The specific type of creature brought forth is chosen at the time the tattoo is created and can be one creature from the 3rd-level list, 1d3 creatures of the same kind from the 2nd-level list, or 1d4+1 creatures of the same kind from the 1st-level list. The tattoo can be activated once per day.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), conjure spell of the appropriate type;

item.name: Summoning Ink, Greater
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i This tattoo appears as a summoning circle with the outline of a monster in it.}

Il tatuaggio è simile alla varietà minore, ma con una sagoma del mostro più grande e un cerchio più elaborato. Il tatuaggio funziona come l'evocazione d'ombra maggiore, con i mostri evocati (tratti dalle liste di evocazione di mostri di VI livello o inferiori) che possiedono il 60% della loro forza normale su bersagli increduli. Il tipo specifico di creatura evocata viene scelto al momento della creazione del tatuaggio e può essere una creatura dall'elenco di 6° livello, 1d3 creature dello stesso tipo dall'elenco di 5° livello o 1d4+1 creature dello stesso tipo da un elenco di livello inferiore. Il tatuaggio può essere attivato una volta al giorno

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Conjure Shadow Demon (UA)|UA}, {@spell Conjure Elemental|PhB} or other appropriate type conjuring spell;

item.name: Tattoo of Fierceness
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i Runic or patterns that surround the bearer's eyes.}

Tattoos of fierceness are usually possessed by rangers or anyone who regularly battles a specific foe, or has a hatred for a specific type of foe. The tattoo surrounds the eyes, creating a fierce visage that gives proficiency (or if character has proficiency expertise) to Intimidation checks and can sometimes cause the targeted enemies to run in fear. Rangers who receive a tattoo of fierceness designate the tattoo to work against their favored enemy (or one of their favored enemies if they have more than one). Anyone other than a ranger who receives this tattoo must also designate a specific "chosen enemy" for it to work against, using the same rules as for favored enemies. The character receives none of the other benefits of the favored enemy class feature. In addition to the bonus to Intimidate checks, once per day the tattoo of fierceness may produce a fear effect (as the cause fear spell) in the chosen enemy (DC 10 + the tattoo bearer's Charisma bonus Wisdom Save to negate). The fear effect does not work against any creature type normally immune to fear. While the tattoo may draw the attention of other enemies, and possibly startle them, it has no intimidation or fear effects against any creatures other than the chosen enemy designated by the receipient of the tattoo.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Fear};

item.name: Tattoo of the Unseen
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i A tattoo of the unseen is an open eye placed at the base of the neck where it is often hidden from view by clothing and long hair.}

The tattoo is usually possessed by rangers or anyone who regularly battles a specific foe. Rangers who receive a tattoo of the unseen designate the tattoo to work against their favored enemy (or one of their favored enemies if they have more than one). Anyone other than a ranger who receives this tattoo must also designate a specific "chosen enemy" for it to work against, using the same rules as for favored enemies (see the ranger class description). The character receives none of the other benefits of the favored enemy class feature. Enemies affected by the tattoo have trouble seeing the tattoo bearer. So long as the tattoo bearer is within what would normally be considered line of sight, the tattoo of the unseen renders him unseen by the chosen enemy type so long as he remains still (a DC 14 Wisdom Save bypasses the effect, allowing the bearer of the tattoo to be seen). If the tattoo bearer moves, he receives advantage to their Stealth check vs. the chosen enemy only. If the chosen enemy makes a successful Perception check, they sense something, but still cannot see the tattoo bearer unless the Wisdom Save is successful. Once the enemy makes a successful Wisdom Save, he cannot be affected by the tattoo again for 24 hours. If the bearer of the tattoo makes any attacks against the chosen enemy, or against anyone within the chosen enemy's line of sight, the effect is instantly lost and the specific enemy cannot be affected again for 24 hours. Note the tattoo bearer is not actually invisible, as any creature other than the chosen enemy designated can still see him. On a similar note, if a friend or ally happens to be of the same type as a designated chosen enemy, they too can be affected by the power of the tattoo and have to make the required Wisdom Save and Perception check to see the tattoo bearer. A tattoo of the unseen and a tattoo of fierceness cannot be possessed by the same character unless each tattoo affects a different chosen enemy type.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell invisibility};

item.name: Track of the Cat
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i This tattoo is a series of several cat's paw prints placed anywhere on the body, usually positioned so it appears that a cat climbed across or up the body part in question.}

The bearer gains darkvision (60ft) and receives a +2 bonus to Athletic (Climbing) and Stealth. If the bearer of track of the cat already has darkvision, they instead gain advantage to Perception checks in dim light.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Enhance Ability};

item.name: Tranquil Repose
entries: Designed for the adventurer who wants to prepare for the worst, tranquil repose tattoos provide protection to the bearer's body after death. Any holy imagery, such as an angel or holy symbol, can be used for a tranquil repose tattoo, as can a brightly burning sun. When the tattoo bearer dies, the tattoo protects the body from rising as undead for six months. If the bearer was killed by vampires or ghouls, whose victims normally rise in their image within a day, they will not rise as undead. Also during the six-month period, the bearer's body cannot be activated by a necromancer. Once the six months are up, a necromancer will be able to activate the body. In addition, the bearer's corpse is preserved for the six-month period after death, which gives the deceased's companions time to either get the body home for burial, or to a temple for resurrection.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Gentle Repose} and {@spell Ceremony|XGE};

item.name: Viezure's Burrowing Claws
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i The character has their hands tattooed with the image of a burrowing creature's claws}

The character has their hands tattooed with the image of a burrowing creature's claws, and gains their power. They can burrow through soft earth or sand at ½ their normal move or hard earth at 1/3 their normal move rate. They cannot burrow through solid stone. They also gain two claw attacks per round as a natural attack using the character's highest BAB, and doing 1d3 damage (1d2 if the tattooed character is Small-sized, 1d4 if Large-sized).

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Move Earth} or {@spell Mold Earth};

item.name: [Weapon Ability] Ink
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i Varies, but symbolic of the property; Fire or flames for Flaming, Ice/snow for frost; Electrical storm/lightning for shock; etc.}

Any +1 weapon special property ability–flaming, frost, keen, shock, etc–can be passed on to an appropriate weapon by the character bearing this tattoo. No matter what type of weapon is being wielded, mundane, masterwork or magical, the special ability property is transferred to the weapon so long as it is wielded. The weapon does have to be of a type that the special ability could normally be applied to. For instance, a keen tattoo power could not be applied to a bludgeoning weapon and a mighty cleaving tattoo power could not be passed on to a longbow. Specific tattoos are usually referred to as flaming ink, keen ink, shock ink, etc. The tattoos always resemble a weapon that seems to display the quality in question (such as a spear surrounded by lightning).

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12)

item.name: Wings of Flight
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i Bird, bat, insect, faerie, or dragon-like wings on the character's back.}

The tattoo allows them to enjoy brief bursts of flight. While the tattoo is activated, the character gains a flight speed equal to their move speed, but cannot change direction in flight. You can fly for up to 1 minutes each day, but the minutes do not need to be consecutive, and can be broken down into rounds.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Fly};

item.name: Wings of Speed
entries: {@b Description}: {@i A small tattoo of wings on the lower legs or feet}
grant a quick boost to one's speed. For 5 minutes each day, the character moves as though under the effects of an expeditious retreat spell.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell expeditious retreat};

item.name: Belly Chain of Enticement
entries: {@b Description}: {@i It consists of a fine but strong chain of gold links. About every three inches, a small ruby dangles from the chain by a few links of gold. It clasps in the back, and can be attached to or passed through a navel ring or stud in the front. The belly chain of enticement is worn around the torso, above the waist.}

Belly chains of enticement are especially popular with dancers of all types, courtesans, rogues and bards, for the chain adds a +3 competence bonus to all Perform (dance) checks. In addition, the wearer receives advantage to all Charisma-based skills when attempting to sweet talk, Persuasions/Deception when seducing someone is feasible.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Blacksmithing and Jeweler's Tools (DC 12), {@spell Enhanced Ability};

item.name: Casshel's Gem of Contraception
entries: {@b Description}: {@i Shaped as a twist of silver wound around a small round citrine gemstone}

This navel jewel is used to prevent childbearing. While worn, it renders the wearer infertile, as per the spell block the seed. It is very popular among adventuring women, courtesans and prostitutes, and more than a few men have been known to wear one, as well.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Block the Seed};

item.name: Charm Bracelet of Summoning (2 charms)
entries: {@b Description}: {@i A charm bracelet of summoning is a simple silver chain bracelet from which dangle 2d3 silver charms. The charms are in the shape of various animals and extraplanar creatures.}

The GM should determine the specific creatures represented by picking them from the 1st through 3rd level summon monster chart in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook. By pulling a charm from the bracelet and tossing it to the ground, the wearer of the bracelet summons the creature. The creature will obey the bracelet wearer and attack or defend as instructed. The creature vanishes after 5 rounds. Once a charm has been used, it is gone and cannot be reused or replaced. When all the charms are gone, the bracelet becomes a nonmagical silver bracelet worth 50 gp.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12);

entries: {@b Description}: {@i A charm bracelet of summoning is a simple silver chain bracelet from which dangle 2d3 silver charms. The charms are in the shape of various animals and extraplanar creatures.}

item.name: Crowe's Silver Tongue Stud
entries: {@b Description}: {@i This simple polished silver tongue stud affects the wearer's speech.}
The character wearing the tongue stud receives a +3 bonus to Persuasion and Deception checks, and treats both skills as a class skill while the tongue stud is worn.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell silver tongue|INK};

item.name: Earring of Translation
entries: {@b Description}: {@i The earring of translation is a large gold stud set with several small gemstones of various types.}
While the earring is worn, the wearer can understand the language of any intelligent species.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell comprend languages};

item.name: Earrings of Mind Linking
entries: {@b Description}: {@i A simple copper hoop earings.}

Earrings of mind linking are a pair of copper hoop earrings that allow two intelligent creatures to communicate through a mental link. Each ring must be worn by the two creatures that wish to communicate–if only one is worn, or one creature wears both, there is no effect. When both earrings are worn by two separate creatures, once per day by touching the earring and speaking a command word, a mental link is forged between the two. Both creatures can communicate telepathically, and they can also each see and hear what the other one sees and hears. The link lasts for up to 80 minutes. There is no range limit for the communication, so long as both creatures wearing the earrings are on the same plane of existence.
If one earring wearer is subjected to a gaze attack while the link is in effect, both earring wearers must make all appropriate saving throws or be affected.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Blacksmithing (DC 12), {@spell Telepathy}, {@spell detect thoughts;

item.name: Handflower of Subtle Charms
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i The handflower of subtle charm is a silver ring connected to a silver bracer via a decorative silver chain. Several small red and pink gems dangle from the chain and the bracelet.}
The wearer of the handflower receives a +1 enhancement bonus to Charisma. In addition, once per day the wearer can cast {@spell charm person} [DC 14].

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell charm person}, {@spell enhance ability};

item.name: Lysse's Loquacious Labret
entries: {@b Description}: {@i A small lapis lazuli lip jewel.}

The labret makes even the most taciturn individual into a veritable chatterbox. The character receives a +5 competence bonus to Linguistics, and treats that skill as a class skill while the labret is worn.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Jeweler's Supplies (DC 14), {@spell Tongues};

item.name: Nipple Shield of Stunning
entries: {@b Tattoo's Description}: {@i This sun-shaped piece of jewelry fits over the nipple}

It is usually–but not always–worn by women. Once per day, the exposed breast and nipple shield can be flashed.Everyone in a ten-foot-cone in front of the wearer must make a DC 15 Wisdom Save or become confused for up to 1 minute. Those who succeed on their save are still stunned until the start of their turn.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Jeweler's Supplies (DC 14), {@spell confusion};

item.name: Teela's Jewel of Fertility
entries: {@b Description}: {@i This jewel is a small carnelian gem set on a silver charm in the shape of three damiana leaves and attached to a silver ring.}

It is often used by witches and the priestesses of fertility gods to help women who are having trouble conceiving. When activated, the wearer is under the effects of a {@spell conception|INK} spell. It can be activated once per day, with a duration of 1 hour.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell conception|INK};

item.name: Tourmaline of Truth
entries: {@b Description}: {@i This tourmaline tipped tongue stud}

The stud appears to grant bonuses to Deception and Persuasion, and for the first 24 hours functions exactly as a {@item Crowe's silver tongue stud|INK}. However, once the initial 24 hours have passed, the wearer of the stud finds himself unable to speak anything but the truth. The wearer can refrain from speaking in order not to reveal information, but otherwise speaks only the truth.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Blur};
{@b Requirements}: as {@item Crowe's silver tongue stud|INK}

item.name: Veronique's Fascinating Navel Ring
entries: {@b Description}: {@i This small belly ring has a short pink and black chain from which dangles a tiny rose quartz gemstone.}

When activated, all creatures within a 15-foot-cone in front of the wearer must make a Wisdom Save (DC equals 11 + the wearer's Charisma modifier) or be fascinated for 1d6 rounds, as per the bard class feature. Those creatures that make their saves cannot be affected by the jewel again for 24 hours.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell hypnotic pattern};

item.name: Branding Kit
entries: A branding kit contains several irons, not unlike fire irons, along with a number of iron symbols and/or letters.

item.name: Branding Kit, Custom
entries: A custom branding kit is made to order, with unique symbols, letters, numbers, holy symbols of deities, house symbols or family crests.

item.name: Flash
entries: Pre-existing sample illustrations of tattoo art, flash is displayed on the walls of a tattoo parlor to give customers an idea of the artist's abilities. Using a piece of flash art negates the designing phase and, because it's a design well practiced by the artist, reduces the tattoo application DC by 5. Simple, basic flash can cost the artist as little as 5 sp in supplies to produce, while large detailed designs can cost as much as 50 gp.

item.name: Henna
entries: Henna is a natural dye used to cover the hands, feet and other body parts with tattoo-like designs that fade after a number of days (usually 3 + 3d6 days). Henna designs grant the wearer a +1 bonus to Deception and Persuasion checks for as long as the henna persists. One package of henna powder (which is mixed with water to use) is enough to cover the hands and feet of two Medium-sized creatures once.

item.name: Henna, Silver
entries: Silver henna is not true henna, but is a unique pigment with similar properties. It is common primarily among the drow, orcs and other darker-skinned races, but is gaining popularity with others. This unique herbal concoction allows intricate tattoo-like designs to show up on dark skin where regular ink or henna would be less visible. Like normal henna, silver henna begins to fade after a few days (usually 3 + 3d6 days). Also like normal henna, silver henna grants a +1 bonus to Deception and Persuasion checks for as long as the henna persists. A package of silver henna powder (which is mixed with water to use)is enough to cover the hands and feet of two Medium-sized creature once.

item.name: Piercing Kit
entries: A piercing kit contains a wide array of needles, clamps, pads, gauze, alcohol, and other implements used to pierce the skin. The cost of a piercing kit does not include jewelry. A piercing kit is exhausted after 10 uses and must be resupplied.

item.name: Scarification Kit
entries: This kit includes knives, scalpels, needles and other specialized tools for creating artistic scars. It also includes alchemical mixtures for coloration of the wounds and to promote rapid healing. The kit is exhausted of all alchemical mixtures after 10 uses and must be resupplied.

item.name: Tattoo Machine, Gnomish
entries: A gnomish-designed contraption that speeds up the tattoo process by rapidly punching the needle into the skin and injecting the ink several times per second. With practice, this makes doing complex tattoos much faster and easier for most artists. Using a tattoo machine effectively requires a +3 or more in Craft (Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies). A tattoo machine reduces the DC of the tattoo by 5 and reduces the time by half. Appropriate needles–bone, gold or steel–must be purchased separately. These machines are made from brass and steel with rubber tubes and steel chains. They have adjustable controls for speed while depth of the needle is controlled by the operator. A foot pump provides the pneumatic pressure. Because of the expense of the equipment there is a lucrative market in second hand tattooing machines. Due to the rapid and powerful punching motion of a gnomish tattoo machine, a tattoo artist can overcome damage reduction/resistance/immunity, and apply ink to creatures whose skin cannot be penetrated by normal tattooing methods.

items: {@i Supplies}: Rubber sap, Metal (4 lbs), Glass Vials (8), Forge

item.name: Tattoo Toolkit, Bone
entries: Tattoo Toolkit, Bone Consists of various size needles or chisels, bamboo needle holders, and a mallet for tapping the design into the flesh. Use these tools grants advantage to the Constitution save of the recipient–tattoos done in this manner are quite painful to receive. As such, they are often used in rites of passage among warlike cultures. Orcs in particular consider enduring such tattoos to be a sign of adulthood. Replacement needles and holders need to be purchased after every 20 uses.

item.name: Tattoo Toolkit, Gold
entries: Tattoo Toolkit, Gold}: Similar to the steel tattoo kit, but with gold needles, which are easier to keep sterile than steel. Due to the reduced risk of infection, gold needles are the tool of choice for tattoo artists who have the means, and they grant advantage on Medicine check. Once a kit is purchased, only replacement holders need to be purchased (after every 20 uses); the needles are good for years unless broken.

item.name: Tattoo Toolkit, Improvised
entries: Tattoo Toolkit, Improvised}: Disadvantage to the tattoo artist's application DC and to  to the Medicine check–such tools (most commonly used in prisons) are rarely effective and are prone to causing infection and scarring. These tools also double the amount of time completing a tattoo will take.

item.name: Tattoo Toolkit, Steel
entries: The standard variety of equipment among tattoo artists, this is an array of steel needles hollowed out to inject the ink. Often this is part of a mechanical device; however there are some types that are hand-operated, much like acupuncture needles. Steel tools are cheap and effective, but cannot be re-used.
They have no benefits or penalties to tattoo work. The kit also includes a variety of sizes of bamboo needle holders. Replacement needles and holders need to be purchased after every 20 uses.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12)

item.name: Tattoo Ink, Advanced Palette
entries: An extended assortment of compound colors for coloring tattoos, stored in small vials or tins.

items: It requires 5 hours and a Craft (Alchemist Supplies) DC 12 check to make.

item.name: Tattoo Ink, Basic Palette
entries: A simple array of primary colors, white, and grey, stored in small vials or tins, this is the rudimentary set of inks for any tattoo artist.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies;
It requires 1 hour and a Craft Alchemy Supplies) DC 10 check to make.

item.name: Tattoo Ink, Black
entries: The most heavily used tattoo ink, black is used for lines and text in basic tattoos and for outlining more complicated designs.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 8), {@spell Blur};
It requires 1 hour and a Craft (Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies) DC 5 check to make.

item.name: Tattoo Ink, Enhanced
entries: Required for enhanced tattoos, this is an alchemical blend of ingredients capable of magical effects.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Alchemist's Supplies Supplies (DC 20)
It requires 5 hours and a Craft (Alchemist's Supplies) DC 20 check to make. One ounce-sized vial.

item.name: Tattoo Ink, Improvised
entries: {@b Description}: {@i An ounce of ink with various floating bits and detritius.}

Made of, well, whatever happens to be available, improvised ink is often used for prison tattoos or by amateur artists. Often the components are slightly toxic, and the recipient must make a Constitution save vs poison, DC 12. (frequency 1/ round for 1d4 rounds; effect 1d2 damage; cure 1 save).
Improvised Ink is what results when you fail a Craft (Alchemy [Ink])

item.name: Tattoo Ink, Spell
entries: {@b Description}: {@i An ounce of ink base that is almost identical to ink used for scribing spells onto scrolls or in spellbooks, this is used for tattooing spells onto the flesh.}

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Alchemist's Supplies (DC 20), {@spell Blur};
It requires 8 hours to make. One potion-sized vial (or set of multiple colors) is enough for 4 spells.

item.name: Tattoo Ink, Wondrous
entries: {@b Description}: {@i Specially prepared ink designed to infuse wondrous abilities into tattoos, this is the most difficult and expensive of all tattoo inks to produce.}

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Tattoo/Body Artist Supplies (DC 12), {@spell Blur};
It requires 12 hours to make, and a Craft (Alchemist's Supplies) DC 25 to make. One ounce potion-sized vial.

item.name: Tattoo Wax
entries: {@b Description}: {@i A natural wax-based ointment used to coat new tattoos to promote proper healing.}

It is applied by the artist after completing the tattoo, reducing his Medicine DC by 5 and allowing the bearer to regain the nonlethal damage incurred by getting a tattoo at double their normal rate. One small tin of ointment is enough to treat 20 Medium-sized tattoos.

items: {@i Prerequisites}: Proficiency w/ Alchemy (DC 10) (Advantage if proficient with Medicine)

reward.name: DELVER INTO DARKNESS (Tattoo)
entries: Having spent two or more adventures in lightless depths, you have adapted and hardened to such surroundings, and the tattoo you received to mark the achievement awakens powers within you. You gain darkvision, 30 feet and gain favored terrain (underground) for YOURSELF ONLY if not a ranger. (see the ranger class features).

reward.name: DRAGONHUNTER (Tattoo)
entries: You have learned from each dragon you've battled, and your lessons have made you more skilled against them. Your tattoo reminds you of your past successes, and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage vs. dragons.

reward.name: IN MEMORY OF THE FALLEN (Tattoo)
entries: You honor a lost companion with a tattoo, which bolsters you in return. The tattoo you've gotten as a memorial to your fallen companion keeps them close to your heart, and gives you a boost of courage when you need it most.
{@b Prerequisite}: A close adventuring partner of yours must have died in battle.

items: The tattoo grants you either a +2 bonus to a single Craft or Perform skill your late friend was especially skilled at,
or a +2 bonus to attack against creatures like those that killed your companion (for example, if your friend was killed by orcs, you would receive the bonus against orcs).

entries: The bonus gained by A holy tattoo belonging to a priest of the Order of the Holy Blade. The tattoo must be selected at the time of application (if you choose the skill bonus, you must pick which skill) and cannot be changed later.
{@b Note}: Simply having a tattoo in memory of a fallen party member does not grant any benefits; you must be awarded this feat.

reward.name: FOE OF THE DROW (Tattoo)
entries: You have a hatred of dark elves and have received a tattoo to mark the number of them you have slain. Upon defeating five drow of your character level or higher, you qualify to be tattooed as a proud enemy of that vile race.
{@b Prerequisite}: Must have defeated at least 5 drow in one-on-one combat, each at least equal to your character level at the time.

items: You gain a +2 bonus to resist drow spells, spell-like abilities and poisons. Your DC for spells for Drow receive a +2 bonus.

entries: This tattoo is very common among many wild elf, wood elf and dwarf clans and tribes.

reward.name: MAJOR SCARIFICATION (Scarification)
entries: You have been intentionally scarred or branded extensively. You're considerably toughened by the scarification you've received and are very capable of enduring pain.
{@b Prerequisite}: Minor Scarification, Toughness, at least five patches of appropriately sized scarification.

items: Proficiency to Wisdom Saves, if double your proficiency bonus if you are already proficient.

reward.name: MINOR SCARIFICATION (Scarification)
entries: You have been intentionally scarred or branded to a minor degree.
{@b Prerequisite}: You must have at least two patches of appropriately sized scarification (i.e. Medium for Medium-sized creatures, Small for Small-sized creatures, etc)

spell.name: Block the Seed

components.m: a piece of citrus peel or a drop of citrus juice

entries: For the spell's duration, you are incapable of becoming pregnant, or impregnating someone else. This spell provides no protection against diseases. While this is a personal-effect spell, many witches brew potions of block the seed for others.

spell.name: Conception

components.m: three damiana leaves, steeped in a cup of hot water and drank by you

entries: With the casting of this spell, you guarantee that on your next attempt, you and your partner will conceive a child. Conception overcomes sterility or infertility in either you or your partner, whether natural or due to an injury, illness, or curse, as well as herbal remedies that normally block conception. Alchemical or magical means of blocking conception, such as block the seed, counter conception and make the spell ineffective. If an attempt to conceive a child is not made within one month of casting, the spell's effects are lost.
While this is a personal-effect spell, many witches brew potions of conception for others.

spell.name: Fresh Ink
entries: You are able to refresh the appearance of a mundane tattoo with just a touch. Faded ink is brightened and looks almost brand-new and clear. Distortions from age and skin-sag are smoothed out and the tattoo is restored to its former appearance.
Fresh ink is a popular spell among busy spellcasting tattoo artists, who can touch up old tattoos quickly and free up time for inking new tattoos.

spell.name: Ink Blast
entries: You blast your enemies with a ray of tattoo ink. You can fire one blast. Each blast requires a ranged touch attack to hit. Targets hit by the ink blast are blinded until the end of their next action, at which time if they succeed a Constitution save they recover their sight. Their face is covered with bright ink of your choice of color. The ink is impossible to wash or rub off and can only be hidden by concealing the face. The ink fades in 1 hour.

spell.name: Mind to Mind
entries: You and another creature forge a mental link that allows telepathic communication, and allows you to see and hear all that the target sees and hears.  After the initial touch to cast the spell, distance between you and the target can be unlimited and the spell will remain in effect, so long as you remain on the same plane of existence.  If the target is subjected to a gaze attack, it may affect you as well–you and the target make separate saving throws.

spell.name: Move Tattoo
entries: You move a single tattoo that is otherwise permanently inked onto your skin to another part of your body. You must be able to touch the tattoo's current location and then touch the destination location. Tattoos can only be moved on the surface of the flesh with this spell; they cannot be moved inside the body, underneath the eyelids, and so forth. The new location will become permanent. You must make a Constitution save with a DC equal to 10 + the tattoo's caster level to move a magical tattoo; failing the save simply results in the tattoo not moving (though you can try again).

spell.name: Silver Tongue
entries: With the casting of this spell, you know exactly the right thing to say. You gain a +2 bonus to all Persuasion checks made through the spell's duration. The bonus increases by 1 per 3 caster levels, to a maximum of +5.

spell.name: Talking Tattoo
entries: You cast this spell upon another person's tattoo, causing the tattoo to begin talking in a loud voice. What the tattoo talks about depends on what the tattoo is: a dragon tattoo will be gruff and demand tribute, a cat tattoo will purr and want attention, a dancing girl tattoo will make suggestive remarks, etc. Even if the tattoo is covered, it still talks (most likely including comments about how it doesn't like being covered up). While the tattoo is talking, the person with the tattoo suffers a disadvantage to all Social and Stealth skill checks

feat.name: Bloodline Brand
entries: Una stregona che conosce la sua linea di sangue ha diritto a essere inchiostrata con un'elaborata rappresentazione della linea di sangue da cui proviene.

items: Aumenta di 1 il proprio punteggio di Carisma, fino a un massimo di 20.

Questa raffigurazione permette allo stregone di accedere ai suoi poteri di stirpe un livello prima del normale. Così, uno stregone di stirpe draconica tatuato con un marchio di stirpe raffigurante un drago ottiene Affinità Elementale, al 5° livello.
Ottiene un ulteriore Cantrip da Stregone appropriato al proprio lignaggio.

feat.name: Fellowship Tattoo

prerequisite.other: Tattoo, Must be a member of a guild, military unit, adventuring company, or the like.

entries: Portate il segno della comunione con gli altri, uniti nello spirito dalla vostra comune fedeltà.

items: Ottenere Tattiche di branco; quando voi o uno dei vostri compagni vi trovate entro 5 piedi da un bersaglio, guadagnate vantaggio agli attacchi e alle prove di abilità contro quel bersaglio.
Guadagna +2 sui tiri salvezza contro gli effetti della paura quando si è in compagnia di altri 2 o più membri del proprio gruppo. Con 20 o più persone, guadagna +4 ai tiri salvezza.
Guadagna 5 HP temporanei dopo un breve riposo con 2 o più membri del gruppo.

entries: {@b Note}: Il semplice possesso del tatuaggio fisico di un sodalizio o di una gilda non conferisce questi benefici: il personaggio deve possedere anche questa impresa. Questo rappresenta un impegno speciale nei confronti del gruppo e non solo un'associazione casuale con il sodalizio.

{@b Special}: Alcune organizzazioni hanno nemici o rivali che prendono di mira il portatore di tale tatuaggio o i suoi associati. L'appartenenza a un gruppo di questo tipo può influenzare le reazioni dei locali in modo positivo o negativo, a seconda della reputazione del gruppo.

feat.name: Greater (un)Holy Tattoo

prerequisite.other: Tattoo, {@feat Improved (Un)Holy Tattoo|INK}, Divine Caster, Level 12

entries: Il vostro simbolo sacro tatuato è una fonte di potere divino.

items: La DC dell'incantatore per gli incantesimi e i tiri salvezza per la DC del Paladino/Clerico aumenta di un ulteriore +1 (+2 totale).
L'uso di un tatuaggio garantisce un +3 alla CA e un +2 ai tiri salvezza fino all'inizio del prossimo turno, mentre si accende un sacro vigore. Si guadagnano anche 8 CV (non cumulabili).
Guadagna 1 uso aggiuntivo di Smite divina.
Gli incantesimi guadagnano +1 per dado (cioè +1 al giorno di guarigione; +1 per dado di danno).

feat.name: Grotesque tattoo

prerequisite.other: Tattoo, may NOT have {@feat Sexy Tattoo|INK}

entries: I suoi tatuaggi sono particolarmente spaventosi e intimidatori.

items: Aumenta il proprio punteggio di Carisma di 1, fino a un massimo di 20.
Si acquisisce la competenza nell'abilità Intimidazione. Se si è già esperti nell'abilità, si aggiunge il doppio del bonus di competenza alle prove effettuate con questa abilità.
Guadagna vantaggio alle prove di Intimidazione quando il tatuaggio è chiaramente visibile.

entries: {@b Note}: Un personaggio non può avere il talento Tatuaggio Sexy se ha il talento Tatuaggio Grottesco.

feat.name: (un)Holy Tattoo (Tattoo)
entries: Il simbolo tatuato della vostra fede è riconosciuto dagli dei.

items: Aumenta il punteggio di Saggezza o di Carisma di 1, fino a un massimo di 20.
Si considera che si sia sempre in possesso di un simbolo sacro come fulcro per lanciare incantesimi divini.
Guadagna un uso aggiuntivo di Incanalare la Divinità; quando si usa Girare (empio/infedele/ marea) la portata si espande a 60 piedi.
Guadagna vantaggio su Presuasione con le prove di abilità contro persone di quella fede; e svantaggio su molte altre (fedi allineate opposte).

entries: {@b Note}: Il semplice tatuaggio del simbolo di una divinità non lo rende utilizzabile come simbolo sacro: il personaggio deve anche compiere questa prova per infondere il potere della sua divinità nel simbolo.

feat.name: Improved (un)Holy Tattoo
entries: Il vostro simbolo sacro tatuato è impregnato di potere divino.

items: La DC degli incantesimi e dei tiri salvezza dell'incantatore per la DC del Paladino/Clerico aumenta di +1.
L'uso di un tatuaggio garantisce un +2 alla CA e un +1 ai tiri salvezza fino all'inizio del prossimo turno, mentre si accende un sacro vigore. Si guadagnano anche 5 CV (non cumulabili).

feat.name: Master Tattoo Artist
entries: La vostra abilità artistica superiore vi permette di creare tatuaggi magicamente migliorati.

items: Aumenta il proprio punteggio di Carisma di 1, fino a un massimo di 20.
Si guadagna la competenza in Forniture per tatuatori/artisti del corpo. Se si è già competenti nell'abilità, si aggiunge il doppio del bonus di competenza alle prove effettuate con essa.
Aggiungere il proprio livello e il bonus di competenza al tasso di produttività giornaliera per la realizzazione di un tatuaggio o di una modifica corporea.

È possibile {@spell identify} l'effetto e lo stato del tatuaggio a vista; con un'ispezione di 10 minuti è possibile generare gli effetti di un {@spell Legend Lore} (cioè l'Artista, la costruzione, la storia, ecc.).

feat.name: Quick Healer
entries: Si recupera dai danni ad una velocità notevole.

items: ridurre i livelli di esaurimento di 2;

entries: Durante un breve riposo, recupera i punti ferita del suo livello.
Guadagna +1 HP da qualsiasi guarigione magica.

{@b Normal}: Si recupera 1 punto ferita all'ora per livello di personaggio con danni non letali, 1 punto ferita per livello di personaggio (letale o non letale) con una notte di riposo completo e il doppio del proprio livello di personaggio in punti ferita per 24 ore di riposo a letto.

feat.name: Reflexive Tattoo
entries: Potete usare i vostri tatuaggi di riflesso in risposta a una minaccia.

items: You may now use the powers of your tattoo(s) also as a bonus action during an encounter, or if you they already can be used as a bonus action as a reaction.
Aggiungi 2 al tuo pool di tatuaggi.

entries: {@b Normal}: Utilizzare un potere del tatuaggio è un'azione.

feat.name: Sexy Tattoo

prerequisite.other: Tattoo, may NOT have {@feat Grotesque Tattoo|INK}

entries: I suoi tatuaggi sono particolarmente affascinanti e aumentano la sua attrattiva.

items: Aumenta il proprio punteggio di Carisma di 1, fino a un massimo di 20.
Si acquisisce la competenza nell'abilità Persuasione. Se si è già abili nell'abilità, si aggiunge un bonus di competenza doppio alle prove effettuate con questa abilità.
Guadagna l'abilità di generare efficacemente un effetto simile a {@spell Friends}, o se si può lanciare {@spell friends} già la sua durata aumenta fino a 10 minuti quando lo si lancia.

entries: {@b Note}: Un personaggio non può avere il talento Tatuaggio Sexy se possiede il talento {@feat Grotesque Tattoo|INK}. Uno svantaggio è che questi tatuaggi fanno sì che le persone vi prendano meno sul serio, subendo uno svantaggio di -2 alle prove di Intimidire. Questi modificatori si applicano solo quando i tatuaggi sono chiaramente visibili.

feat.name: Tattoo Mastery
entries: Avete padroneggiato un piccolo numero di tatuaggi di incantesimi e potete preparare questi incantesimi senza fare alcun riferimento al vostro caudex.

items: Aumenta il punteggio di Intelligenza di 1, fino a un massimo di 20.
Aggiungere permanentemente alla lista degli incantesimi preparati un numero di incantesimi pari al proprio bonus di competenza, tatuandoli sulla pelle.
Si ottiene la competenza nell'abilità Arcana. Se si è già esperti nell'abilità, si aggiunge il doppio del bonus di competenza alle prove effettuate con essa.

feat.name: Wizard's Mark
entries: Vi siete fatti tatuare o bruciare nella carne il vostro simbolo arcano.
{@b Benefit}: Se ti fai imprimere nella carne il tuo simbolo arcano personale, tramite tatuaggio o marchio...

items: +1 DC Incantesimi per gli incantesimi della propria Tradizione (se si segue una scuola)
Si ottiene la competenza nell'abilità Arcana. Se si è già esperti nell'abilità, si aggiunge il doppio del bonus di competenza alle prove effettuate con essa.
